Start an interactive Linux container

This procedure describes how to start and interactive Linux container.

  1. Pull the latest image of amazonlinux

     docker pull amazonlinux:latest

  2. Navigate to your working folder.

  3. Create a container of the image

     docker run -it `
   -v "$(pwd):/usr/$(hostname)"
   --rm `
   --name my-linux `
   amazonlinux

    Where

    • -i and -t runs the container on an interactive terminal
    • -v mounts the current working folder to the container directory /usr/[hostname], where hostname is the machine name.
    • --rm automatically removes the container on exit

  4. From the bash shell, navigate to /usr/temp to find the contents of the working folder.

     cd /usr/temp

  5. Ctrl-Shift-P to detach from container. To reattach, execute the following:

     docker attach my-linux

  6. From the bash shell, enter exit to exit the container.
